title: Oshosondy
author: Oshosondy
content: I do not know the right board I can move this to, if not scam accusation, you can let me know.I have known different scam on telegram and I know how to avoid them. But recently I joined a telegram group which is about a presale. I do not use to buy presale but I decided to go for this one with the amount of money that I can afford to lose. Since I joined the presale telegram group, my telegram has been filled with scammers messaging me using the name similar the telegram group that I joined. That did not pain me because I know how to avoid them. But I decide to be reporting them to telegram moderators because you can report any group or channel, but none of them has been banned and I keep reporting them but nothing done and they are still active. We have been saying something about google but I think Telegram is the worst.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Yeah, I have similar experiences as well, and it seems that once your account has been exposed, this scammers are going to target you in hope that you will fall for their trap.So I just learn how to ignore most of them, and just keep reminding myself that it is a haven for scammers and hackers and all kind of individuals who just think of taking advantage of other people to steal their crypto.This post should remind everyone, specially those newbies in crypto world that you shouldn't trust anyone that is going to message you of some form of investments with this "x" amount of returns.

But I decide to be reporting them to telegram moderators because you can report any group or channel, but none of them has been banned and I keep reporting them but nothing done and they are still active. We have been saying something about Google but I think Telegram is the worst.You can say that again I have a share of experience on telegram on people trying to scam me if you're active on one group like a bounty or a pre-sale group and they see you leaving comments they will tag you and message and some of them are even impersonating the admin of the group you're in, that is why you can see in the admins' profile the word they will not send a PM to you first, I am very quick to hit block if early on our conversation he tells me things that are too good to be true, I will not fall to this scheme.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: 1. If you are getting scammed or messaged by strangers on Telegram, perhaps you should just take a look at the app's security settings.  2. Using the default settings and not securing your account properly opens you up to many scams.  This has been going on for years. I've even been accused of it myself by some forum loser with a big brain/head.

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: Scammers are creative, victims are gullible. Nothing new there. Easy fix: don't trust it, and don't use it.

comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 25, 2023, 12:11:50 PMSince I joined the presale telegram group, my telegram has been filled with scammers messaging me using the name similar the telegram group that I joined. That did not pain me because I know how to avoid them. But I decide to be reporting them to telegram moderators because you can report any group or channel, but none of them has been banned and I keep reporting them but nothing done and they are still active. We have been saying something about google but I think Telegram is the worst.I think that all the communities of the popular projects, platforms, wallets .. etc., in the crypto market on the Telegram app their members are targeted by scammers. The Telegram application has become one of the best and most indispensable communication applications and has a vast user base. I can confirm that all or most users have probably come across one of the scammers who DMs them first.You can find the option to report and block at the top of the account & If you provide your evidence and necessary details about any of the scammers and the reasons you believe they are scammers through https://t.me/notoscam or the following email: abuse@telegram.org. After the Telegram team reviews your report, they may impose restrictions on the account for a period of 7 days. After repeated reports from other members, the period of restriction on sending messages will be increased, and then finally, the ban will be imposed on the scammer's telegram account permanently.Unfortunately, even if their accounts are banned, they will create other accounts with virtual numbers and continue to deceive people, so the solution is to block and report everyone who DMs you first, as group moderators follow this rule to protect their community.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Exactly - Telegram is a nest of fraudsters with many crimes.Have me ever asked something in the official Telegram group of a certain platform when voicing a complaint or whatever and there was a PM in the name of a fake admin who wanted to help with the complaint, it wasn't just one or two foreigners who PM'd but many, even though I knew how to anticipate it, I still saw annoyance. when you see this on telegram.Several times when reporting there was no response at all from Telegram, well maybe one report won't be responded to but with lots of reports maybe the fraudsters can be blocked.

comments.author: blue Snow
comments.body: i had the same experience with you a couple of months ago. I don't know who invited me to join the airdrop group and participate to receive a free new token. What makes me worry is someone asked me by PM to send KYC to get the free coin, he knows my real name and knows that I used to like to join in the past. I ignored him and didn't reply to his PM. I just reported the group to Telegram, but until today the group still exists and is not banned like an example.

comments.author: Drawesome
comments.body: Telegram is full of bots. That's why I loved those groups asking a few sats to join. The one I knew of used to do it with lntxtbot (no longer active), but I guess it'd be possible to use some altternative. That's the only way to avoid bots

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Modify the Telegram settings so that no one can add you to any group unless you have registered its number. Search for options to enhance privacy and choose the one that suits you. Since you do not provide a service or sell products, you do not need strangers to communicate with you.Telegram is full of scammers and they always find a way to convince you and they are ready to put in a lot of effort for one dollar, so do not let greed control you and stay away from joining any channel or bot related to money or that promises you profits.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: That's why I mostly avoid telegram groups if it's about to crypto related channels. You'll always get those random people messaging you of something they've found out and it's a great opportunity that they're sharing as if they've found that will change your life and they're very optimistic about it. I guess Telegram really needs to step up on this one and has to do something with these users. But with them having the premium, many scammers can just avoid that and with their feature of easy changing the usernames/names of each user, it's one reason why it has became a den of scammers. So if Telegram isn't really doing anything against them, you just block those random messages that you get because you will really get these messages every channel you join, they're like watchers and observers waiting for some new people to message.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: If you think about it, it's only logical that scammers will try to take advantage of you. Firstly, you joined a presale campaign of a token. That could itself be a scam, considering the overall history of ICOs and various crowdfunding crypto campaigns. When you join the group, scammers see a new person who probably has money to invest. Their logic says, let's give this person something to invest in and see how it goes. That's going to be enough in many cases to trick people.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: This is applicable to every one of these platforms, since the ICO days, impersonators trying to steal money from investors on the sale days has been happening. For those who know how to avoid them its fine but is irritating. It is better to avoid these social media or messenger apps on such days and only use the official sites.Quote from: Oshosondy on September 25, 2023, 12:11:50 PM We have been saying something about google but I think Telegram is the worst. Any such social media or search engine is the same. They will not filter out bad things for you, you have to decide which one to take in.Often these people will have proxy accounts inside the group and a scammer outside the group and the data collected through the proxy will be used to contact via the scammer account - in such cases mods are out of power because the scammer account is not in the group at all. Whenever you see an account that is not having any common group with you and is messaging you, block it, 99% it is a cold call scammer.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: There was a day I wanted to lay complaint in exchange for holding my deposit not to reflect, immediately I did that on the telegram group I saw series of messages coming to me for assistance while the main admin with tag hasn't responded to me on the telegram group, they clone the name of the admin and using it to pm me, I think is impersonation. Although I was conscious of receiving those messages and to what they are saying is for me to reveal my login details so along the line their discussion wasn't in line to help me rather they are interested for my login email and password. Then I noticed it was scammer and what I did was to block them all later run the admin responded to me in the telegram group without sending me messages. Telegram is not a safe place for business is too open for one to easily get scammed.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: I'm not sure it's telegram the one to blame here! The features it offers are supposed to be used to enhance users privacy. Allowing users to create as many accounts as they want almost anonymously, deleting conversations... is not always a bad thing. Users who value their privacy know that.Telegram is a double edged sword. It's the responsibility of the user to know how to use it the right way and how to protect himself from abusers.
